intro: Brassica orientalis, commonly known as oriental mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous vegetables and flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are elongated and lobed. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. The plant is known for its pungent odor and is often used in traditional medicine and as a condiment.
